metadata.name: Sci-Fi Frontier Generator
metadata.author: Rolldeo
metadata.description: A **science fiction** generator for creating ships, planets, stations, characters, and cosmic phenomena. Perfect for generating descriptive content for space opera settings.

tables.name: Ship Classes
tables.description: Classification of spacecraft by size and role

sets.silhouette: compact, angular hull with stubby wings
sleek, needle-like hull with swept-back fins
blocky, utilitarian hull with external cargo pods
imposing, wedge-shaped hull bristling with sensor arrays

entries.value: pristine, fresh from the shipyard with that new-vessel gleam
well-maintained with only minor cosmetic wear
showing years of hard service with patched hull sections
battle-scarred and held together by desperate repairs
a frankenstein of salvaged parts from multiple vessels
The navigation computer has developed an oddly sarcastic personality.
Strange harmonic vibrations occur during FTL transit.
The previous owner's exotic pet left permanent claw marks everywhere.
The ship's AI insists on playing classical music during docking procedures.
One cargo bay has a persistent zero-gravity malfunction.
The hull makes unsettling groaning sounds when cooling down.
A faint smell of ozone permeates the engineering section.
The emergency lights flicker on and off at random intervals.
All displays show a slight purple tint that no one can fix.
The captain's chair squeaks loudly with every movement.
Roll twice for multiple quirks: {{2*unique*again|" Additionally, "}}.

sets.atmosphere: thick, humid atmosphere laden with salt spray
thin, dusty atmosphere that glows orange at sunset
sets.surfaceDesc: vast dune seas and exposed bedrock mesas

sets.atmosphere: biting cold atmosphere with perpetual ice crystals
sets.surfaceDesc: glacial plains and frozen methane lakes

sets.atmosphere: thick, steamy atmosphere rich with spores
choking atmosphere filled with ash and sulfur
sets.surfaceDesc: rivers of lava and obsidian plains

sets.atmosphere: crushing layers of hydrogen and helium
sets.surfaceDesc: no solid surface, only deepening cloud layers

entries.value: breathable atmosphere with a slight metallic tang
dense atmosphere that makes voices sound oddly deep
pristine atmosphere reminiscent of mountain air
slightly toxic atmosphere requiring filter masks outdoors
rolling grasslands dotted with crystalline rock formations
mountainous terrain with deep valleys and rushing rivers
lush forests interspersed with mirror-flat lakes
jagged canyon systems carved by ancient waterways
A massive ring system visible from the surface, painting the sky with bands of light.
Twin moons that create dramatic tidal effects and eclipse events.
Ancient alien ruins scattered across the northern continent.
A colossal impact crater visible from orbit, now home to a unique ecosystem.
Bioluminescent organisms that make the night glow in shifting colors.
Floating islands held aloft by deposits of anti-gravity minerals.
Massive electromagnetic storms that circle the equator perpetually.
Crystal forests that chime in the wind, audible for kilometers.
Underground ocean accessible through vast cave networks.
Migrating continent-sized organisms that reshape the geography.

sets.description: a proper small city with districts

sets.architecture: modular cargo bays surrounding a central promenade
sprawling refineries attached to asteroid moorings
clean lines and isolated containment sections
sweeping crystal viewports and gilded surfaces

sets.atmosphere: transient crowds and flickering departure boards
sets.architecture: efficient docking arms and minimal amenities
armored hull sections and restricted zones

sets.atmosphere: the smell of old metal and opportunities
sets.architecture: chaotic sprawl of docked hulks and cutting bays

entries.value: thriving, with expansion modules being added regularly
stable, maintaining the same population for decades
declining, with vacant sections and failing systems
newly established, still smelling of fresh sealant
recovering from a recent crisis that left visible scars
Tall and willowy with luminescent skin that shifts between pale blue and silver
Compact and sturdy with four arms and chitinous plating in earthy browns
Serpentine lower body with a humanoid torso, scales in iridescent greens
Avian features with vestigial wings and feathers ranging from crimson to gold
Amorphous form that can reshape at will, typically appearing as a shifting mass of translucent gel
Crystalline body structure that refracts light into rainbows, no discernible face
Feline grace with sleek fur patterns and large, reflective eyes adapted for low light
Aquatic adaptation with gills, webbed appendages, and skin in deep ocean blues
communicate primarily through color changes and bioluminescent patterns
consider individual names taboo, referring to each other by role and lineage
practice elaborate gift-giving rituals that determine social standing
experience time non-linearly and speak of past and future interchangeably
share a limited hive-mind connection with close family members
express emotion through scent rather than facial expressions
consider lying physically impossible and are easily deceived by other species
hibernate for one month each year during their species' ancestral spawning season
revere silence as sacred and conduct important business in complete quiet
age in reverse, born with full knowledge that fades as they grow younger
average height with a wiry build
lanky with elongated limbs from low-gravity upbringing
stocky and broad-shouldered with visible cybernetic reinforcement
lanky with elongated limbs and subtle genetic optimization markers
entirely synthetic, with a humanoid form of polished chrome and soft polymers
prematurely gray hair despite apparent youth
unusual skin pigmentation in shades of {{skinTones}}
hands that never seem to stop moving, always fidgeting
a distinctive accent from the {{regionNames}} colonies
old burn marks partially hidden by clothing
eye with a faintly glowing iris
neural interface port at the temple
antique pocket watch on a chain
military dog tags from a forgotten war
religious medallion from an obscure faith
deep blue from colonial gene therapy
faint gray from prolonged space habitation
laughs easily and finds humor in dark situations
maintains an unsettling stillness when listening
constantly checks exits and keeps back to walls
uses elaborate hand gestures when speaking
maintains formal speech patterns regardless of situation
seeking revenge for a wrong committed decades ago
trying to earn enough credits to buy back a family debt
searching for a missing sibling lost during the last war
running from a past identity that refuses to stay buried
collecting specimens for a personal research obsession
hoping to find a legendary location from old spacer tales
working to expose corruption in a powerful organization
simply trying to survive one more day in a hostile universe
pursuing an art form that requires travel to master
fulfilling a promise made to someone now dead

tables.name: Factions
tables.description: Major power groups in the setting

entries.description: The remnant of the old empire, clinging to authority through bureaucracy
An alliance of independent merchants who value profit and freedom
A faith dedicated to restoring humanity's lost homeworld
A galaxy-spanning criminal organization with legitimate fronts
Those who believe humanity must evolve beyond flesh
Colonists banded together to protect the outer worlds

sets.symbol: a raised fist holding a star

tables.name: Space Anomaly Types
tables.description: Strange phenomena encountered in deep space

entries.value: a gravitational eddy that pulls ships off course
a nebula cloud crackling with exotic radiation

sets.visualDesc: swirling colors of violet and gold

entries.value: the wreckage of an ancient vessel of unknown design

sets.visualDesc: geometric shapes that hurt to look at directly

entries.value: a stable wormhole leading to unknown coordinates

sets.visualDesc: a perfect circle of absolute darkness ringed with light

entries.value: a rogue planet drifting through the void

sets.visualDesc: a dark sphere occluding distant stars

entries.value: crystalline structures growing in vacuum defying known physics
a region where electronics behave erratically
the ghostly image of ships that aren't really there

sets.visualDesc: translucent vessels that fade when approached

tables.name: Cargo by Rarity
tables.description: Select cargo with weighted probability by rarity tier

tables.name: All Cargo Types
tables.description: Combined pool of all cargo types

entries.value: dangerous due to unstable jump points
A dense asteroid belt rich in minerals.
Multiple gas giants with extensive moon systems.
An Oort cloud unusually close to the inner system.
Unusual electromagnetic emissions from an unknown source.
A Lagrange point station serving as a trade hub.
Debris from a recent or ancient space battle.
A comet with a spectacular multi-colored tail.
Tidally locked worlds with extreme temperature gradients.
A Dyson swarm in early construction phases.
data broker specializing in corporate secrets
medical officer on a frontier station
jump drive engineer keeping ships moving

tables.name: All Character Appearances
tables.description: Combined pool of human and enhanced human appearances

entries.value: Heavy cloud cover blocking most sunlight
Dust storm reducing visibility to meters
Eerily calm before an approaching superstorm
Meteor shower lighting up the night sky
The air hums with the constant vibration of machinery.
A tense silence hangs over everything, broken only by distant echoes.
Conversations blend into a warm buzz of activity.
Warning lights cast everything in intermittent red flashes.
Music from multiple sources creates a chaotic soundscape.
The recycled air carries a faint chemical undertone.
Footsteps echo sharply on metal grating.
The space feels abandoned despite signs of recent activity.
A distress signal repeats from coordinates that don't exist on any chart.
Someone is paying triple rates for cargo delivery to a quarantined world.
An old friend appears after being declared dead for years.
A data chip was slipped into someone's pocket on the station.
The local authorities are looking for someone matching a crew member's description.
A rival crew claims they own the same ship.
The cargo started moving on its own during transit.
A wealthy patron wants to be smuggled off-world, no questions asked.
The station's AI has been sending encrypted messages to unknown recipients.
An alien artifact was accidentally included with legitimate salvage.
They say there's a ghost ship that appears before major disasters.
I heard the Hegemony found something in the outer systems they're keeping quiet.
Word is {{factions}} is recruiting anyone with a pulse.
Someone found a working pre-collapse AI, completely intact.
There's a planet out there where everyone who lands starts aging backwards.
The {{corporationPrefixes}}{{corporationSuffixes}} CEO hasn't been seen in months - replaced by a synth, maybe.
Pirates hit another convoy near the {{regionNames}} beacon.
Prices on {{cargoCommon}} are about to spike - buy now.
That new station? Built on top of alien ruins. Mark my words.
The jump point near {{starNames}} is becoming unstable.
The person you need to meet is in custody.
A third party is also after the same objective.
The promised payment is in a currency no one accepts.
The contact has been replaced by someone else.
Critical equipment malfunctions at the worst moment.
An old debt comes due right now.
The objective isn't what it was described as.
There's a hidden time limit no one mentioned.
Multiple contacts on an intercept course.
Unusual energy signature from the asteroid field.
Debris field consistent with recent ship destruction.
Encrypted transmission on a restricted frequency.
Life signs where there shouldn't be any.
Radiation spike from the nearby star.
Stealth signature - something is trying to hide.
Nothing at all - suspiciously empty space.
